rule-21-1-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones. The zones are served by a baseline system type 7 with purchased hot water in both the proposed and baseline model.
rule-21-1-a.expected_raised_message_includes: Manual Check Required - Proposed is modeled with purchased hot water or steam.  Make sure the heating source in the baseline building is also purchased hot water or steam.

standard.rule_description: For systems using purchased hot water or steam, the heating source shall be modeled as purchased hot water or steam in both the proposed design and baseline building design. If any system in the proposed design uses purchased hot water or steam, all baseline systems with hot water coils shall use the same type of purchased hot water or steam.

rule-21-1-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones. The zones are served by a baseline system type 7 with a conventional boiler (not purchased hot water) in both the proposed and baseline model.
rule-21-1-b.expected_raised_message_includes: Rule 21-1 Not Applicable - the proposed is not modeled with Purchased Hot Water or Steam

standard.rule_description: For systems using purchased hot water or steam, the heating source shall be modeled as purchased hot water or steam in both the proposed design and baseline building design. If any system in the proposed design uses purchased hot water or steam, all baseline systems with hot water coils shall use the same type of purchased hot water or steam.

rule-21-2-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones. The zones are served by a baseline system type 7 with purchased hot water in both the proposed and baseline model.
rule-21-2-a.expected_raised_message_includes: Manual Check Required - Proposed is modeled with purchased hot water or steam.  Make sure the baseline model uses the same number of pumps for the heating loop.

standard.rule_description: For purchased HW/steam in the proposed model, the baseline shall have the same number of pumps as proposed

rule-21-2-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones. The zones are served by a baseline system type 7 with a conventional boiler (not purchased hot water) in both the proposed and baseline model.
rule-21-2-b.expected_raised_message_includes: Rule 21-2 Not Applicable - the proposed is not modeled with Purchased Hot Water or Steam

standard.rule_description: For purchased HW/steam in the proposed model, the baseline shall have the same number of pumps as proposed

rule-21-3-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a boiler. The baseline building's hot water system sizing is based on coincident loads.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building is modeled with a hot water or chilled water plant the plant shall be sized based on coincident loads.

rule-21-3-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a boiler. The baseline building's hot water system sizing is not based on coincident loads.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building is modeled with a hot water or chilled water plant the plant shall be sized based on coincident loads.

rule-21-3-c.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 5 with a boiler. The baseline building's hot water system sizing is based on coincident loads.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building is modeled with a hot water or chilled water plant the plant shall be sized based on coincident loads.

rule-21-3-d.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 5 with a boiler. The baseline building's hot water system sizing is not based on coincident loads.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building is modeled with a hot water or chilled water plant the plant shall be sized based on coincident loads.

rule-21-3-e.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by a baseline system type 2. There are no plant systems.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building is modeled with a hot water or chilled water plant the plant shall be sized based on coincident loads.

rule-21-4-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a natural draft boiler.

standard.rule_description: When baseline building does not use purchased heat, baseline systems 1,5,7,11,12 shall be modeled with natural draft boilers.

rule-21-4-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a forced boiler.

standard.rule_description: When baseline building does not use purchased heat, baseline systems 1,5,7,11,12 shall be modeled with natural draft boilers.

rule-21-4-c.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by a baseline system type 11 with a natural draft boiler.

standard.rule_description: When baseline building does not use purchased heat, baseline systems 1,5,7,11,12 shall be modeled with natural draft boilers.

rule-21-4-d.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by a baseline system type 11 with a forced draft boiler.

standard.rule_description: When baseline building does not use purchased heat, baseline systems 1,5,7,11,12 shall be modeled with natural draft boilers.

rule-21-4-e.test_description: The project has one building segment with one zone served by a baseline system type 3. There are no boilers.

standard.rule_description: When baseline building does not use purchased heat, baseline systems 1,5,7,11,12 shall be modeled with natural draft boilers.

rule-21-5-a.test_description: The project has one 12,000 ft2 building segment with two zones and two spaces. The zones are served by a baseline system type 7 with a single boiler.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building requires boilers, (for baseline system type = 1,5,7,11 and 12), for building area>15,000ft2, two equally sized boilers should be modeled. Else a single boiler shall be modeled.

rule-21-5-b.test_description: The project has one 12,000 ft2 building segment with two zones and two spaces. The zones are served by a baseline system type 7 with two boilers.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building requires boilers, (for baseline system type = 1,5,7,11 and 12), for building area>15,000ft2, two equally sized boilers should be modeled. Else a single boiler shall be modeled.

rule-21-5-c.test_description: The project has one 24,000 ft2 building segment with one zone and one space. The zone is served by a baseline system type 12 with two equally sized boilers.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building requires boilers, (for baseline system type = 1,5,7,11 and 12), for building area>15,000ft2, two equally sized boilers should be modeled. Else a single boiler shall be modeled.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building requires boilers, (for baseline system type = 1,5,7,11 and 12), and is modeled with two boilers, each boiler shall be staged based on load.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building requires boilers, (for baseline system type = 1,5,7,11 and 12), and is modeled with two boilers, each boiler shall be staged based on load.

rule-21-7-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a hot water loop. The hot water supply temperature is 180 F and the hot water return temperature is 130 F.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building requires boilers, (for baseline system type = 1,5,7,11 and 12), the hot water supply temperature (HWST) shall be 180F, and the hot water return temperature (HSRT) shall be 130F

rule-21-8-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a hot water loop. The hot water loop supply temperature is reset based on the prescribed outdoor air dry-bulb temperature reset schedule.

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building requires boilers, (for baseline system type = 1,5,7,11 and 12),,  HWST for the baseline building shall be reset using an outdoor air dry-bulb reset schedule. 180F at 20F OAT, 150Fat 50F OAT, ramped linerarly between 150F and 180F.

rule-21-10-a.test_description: The project has one 100,000 ft2 building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a hot water loop. The hot water pump speed control is fixed-speed (riding the pump curve).

standard.rule_description: When the baseline building uses boiler)s) or purchased hot water, the hot water pump shall be modeled as riding the pump curve if the hot water system serves less than 120,000 ft^2 otherwise it shall be modeled with a VFD.

rule-21-18-a.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a hot water loop. The hot water boiler uses natural gas as the fuel source.

standard.rule_description: For baseline building, fossil fuel systems shall be modeled using natural gas as their fuel source. Exception: For fossil fuel systems where natural gas is not available for the proposed building site as determined by the rating authority, the baseline HVAC systems shall be modeled using propane as their fuel.

rule-21-18-b.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a hot water loop. The hot water boiler uses electricity as the fuel source.

rule-21-18-c.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a purchased hot water loop. There are no boilers.

rule-21-18-d.test_description: The project has one building segment with two zones served by a baseline system type 7 with a hot water loop. The hot water boiler uses propane as the fuel source.
rule-21-18-d.expected_raised_message_includes: Baseline boiler fuel source is modeled as propane. Verify if natural gas is not available for the proposed building site as determined by the rating authority.
